taskbody.prereq:
A few things that you need:
A power sander
A new list item
another
Sanding pads
An air compressor
A paint sprayer

info.p: Before you begin any actual painting, you will need to find a suitable location.
Make sure your paint job does not accentuate any imperfections – fix any visible dents, repair any rust, and remove chrome or plastic trim.

Give your paint a smooth and even surface onto which it can adhere – sand your entire vehicle using circular motions, either all the way to the bare metal, to the original primer, or at least enough for your new coat of paint to adhere to.
Holding your spray gun approximately six inches away from your vehicle’s surface, and using a side-to-side sweeping motion, apply paint in thin and even coats.
